text: BEST FISH TACOS EVER! Great fajitas, great tortas! I try to order something new every time I go there and everything has been delicious. Horchata is delicious and refreshing!

This place is terrible. The nachos were all of 8 soggy chips with cheese and beans. I posted a picture. This is a soggy quesadilla. I brouht it back and was told this is the nachos. I'll never return. On top of that it was 9.99. Ridiculous!

This is a wonderful local place. The carnitas taco salad must have over a half pound of meat.  It blew me away.  The half pitcher of sangria is the way to do it.  They gave us a complimentary kailua and cream at the end.  Wow who does that anymore?
This place isn't too bad, great margaritas and chips and salsa are good.  Got a taco with some beans and rice, really good, reasonably priced, would definitely go back.

Calm and  ok ambiance.. clean Food is very delicious the salsa is over the top Great food presentation  Overall i give it a B experience Decor - C  although it has alot to do with maintaining its originality.

Came here on a sunday afternoon. The weather was lovely in the windy city so they had their patio open! But the hubby and I sat inside for the A.C. The inside of Fiesta Mexican does look like a "Fiesta Mexicana"! Colorful, with party decors and very bright. It def has that Mexican party vibe. To keep the party vibe going, my husband and I shared a 1/2 pitcher of margarita that was only 17 dollars! Plenty of margaritas came out of that pitcher. It was worth it. Food was delicious too-- I ordered the Red Snapper in a garlic and onion sauce and my husband had the "Carne Asada". Our plates were HUUUUGE! Everything tasted fresh and delicious that i couldn't stop eating. We skipped dessert because of how much we enjoyed our entrees. We couldn't fit anything else but our lovely server gave us a shot of kahlua topped with cream which was a great way to take in some sweets!
Excellent food and fast service,  even when packed.  Waitress could have come around more often for drink refills but it wasn't that bad. Restroom location is inconvenient. Reasonable prices.

My boss and I ordered delivery at 12:10pm it is now 1:50pm and I called them back. The lady tells me the credit card was declined. Maybe it was decline because we had to go over the card number 5 different times. She never called to tell us this had happened, so now we are stuck. When I called back and was told this I asked for a manager and she told me there is no manager today. I said on a Friday there is nobody in charge? She told me no and that the manager will be in tomorrow. Horrible.
Amazingly authentic flavors!! Azteca Chicken tortilla Soup is absolutely to die for. Seriously I could have 4 bowls. Extremely fast and friendly service!

My husband and I used to come in to Fiesta regularly when we lived in Chicago.  Well,  we moved back and it didn't disappoint!  Good service,  festive atmosphere,  and the best bang-for-your-buck margaritas in the city!  The food is good, too.

Went to celebrate my friend's Birthday. She ordered some shrimp dish that turned out to be too hot for her no problem they let her order something else  They didn't even know about her birthday!!   The staff was great. When I want Mexican food will go back.

Seating is cramped. Service was excellent. Could use some updating inside. Ordered the tortilla soup which was flavorful and filling at $7. We also had the fundido cheese dip and it wasn't that fun...would skip next time. Not the best but not the worst place - salsa was odd colored but good.

You probably would want to pass on this place.  A large group and I came after 11pm one night after seeing a show at the Uptown Underground down the street. This place is open pretty late (2 or 3 am I think), so it was an appealing place for those of us looking for some snacks and drinks.  First thing I have to tell you is that you should NEVER try the margarita's here. I had the basic lime one and it tasted like I was drinking lime flavored kitchen cleaner. I am well aware that many restaurants use pre made mixes for the base of their margarita's, but they really need to switch brands here. Even the Jose Cuervo margarita mixes I used to drink in college tasted better then whatever is used in the margarita's at this restaurant.  I asked the waiter to take it off of my bill, and I was thankful that he did. The margarita was totally undrinkable, and it was literally the worst margarita I've ever had.  Many of the people at my table had tacos, and most people said that the meat was bland. The person next to me said that the tortilla was slightly chewy.  I had one of their tamales, and it wasn't bad, but also not memorable either.  The prices for most items on the menu were priced a little high for the quality of the ingredients.

Bad tamales, terrible nachos and a terrible portion of nachos (more like a Mexican pizza from Taco Bell cut into 8 pieces), minimal alcohol in the margaritas...seriously...don't go. It's not good. It's not even bad. A terrible experience. Nice servers though.

Great atmosphere. It's a good spot to warm up after music event nearby. Unfortunately not great good&service with 2.5stars. First of all, my menu was dirty with sauce. I ordered crab cake appetizer. Obviously it was warmed in microwave that center was cold, outside was soggy, sauce looked in fresh.( even a waitress recommended / she didn't check up after put the plate) Entree was tacos enchiladas comb. It was dull taste, somehow included vegi taco on meat order. I prefer to order normal taco vender on the street. Fountain in plastic glass then not free refill. It was surprising. At least I enjoyed live music.
Good post-climb (First Ascent - Uptown) refuel...food good, but when you sit outside, you have a homeless person come by and ask you for food or money (happened on two different occasions)
Service was great. Atmosphere is nice and authentic. But the food is subpar. Probably the worst taco I've ever had.

Neighborhood-feel Mexican restaurant with all the staples you'd expect. Standard Mexican-inspired decor, rickety wooden chairs, and margaritas served in large ceramic pitchers. Gets the job done with none of the fancy stuff. Food is average, but not out-of-this world. Place is rarely busy, usually always a table available, which is nice. Staff is friendly with seat yourself tables. $18 margarita pitcher for a Tuesday isn't bad (tequila Tuesday!) and complimentary mixed shots of creme liqueur and coffee liqueur are a nice cap to the dinner. Had the nachos to start, which are dressed individually rather than the messy nachos style, and ordered the appetizer mini steak quesadillas which were plenty as a meal. Friends ordered basic combination plates that can be found at any place like this, and the food was exactly what we were looking for.

Went there with a big group of us for a graduation dinner. Small place but servers were friendly and on top of things. Things worth noting: 1. Table salsa was spicy for table salsa. I really liked it but the people in the group who didn't care for spicy had a rough go of it. 2. There were a lot of different dinners that were ordered. The beans and rice were very good and the Carne asada was EXCELLENT. Others in the group enjoyed the chicken flautas, empanadas, and the chimichanga. The only thing that no one really loved was the tamale. 3. Pricing/ value for everything was very reasonable. Nothing was out of line. The Carne asada was a little more than what we wanted to spend but it was worth every penny. 4. After dinner small shot for the adults was a nice and unexpected touch. Also enjoyalble. Overall it was a very good dinner in a friendly neighborhood in the Chicago area. If you're ever in the area it's worth a trip.

Went here for Cuatro De Mayo and suprisingly it wasnt that crowded... Very nice service, food came out fast and accurate.. However,here are some negatives; chips were ok but not a good salsa, hot and watery( i prefer chunky and with more flavor)...  Pastor tacos were average but was taken back from a 13 dollar charge for taco dinner... Girlfriend had the Cheese Enchilladas with mole sauce... I thought the mole sauce was uninspiring and bland... Margareitas were decent but nothing special... I did enjoy when the bill came, they brought out 2 shots for me and the girl( no charge)... Probably influenced my tip but whatcha going do...

Having grown up In a Mexican family, my grandmother made all the food by hand. This place hands down is that recreation of my grandmothers food. Excellent place to come eat if you really do want true Mexican food. Not that crap at Wanna-be Mexican restaurants that are all commercial and no soul.  Stop reading & come on in!

Good Azteca Tortilla Soup, but guacamole was dark greenish brown on the outside - it had oxidized from sitting around too long - yuck! They do have the best salsa. Jalapeno poppers also seemed to have been sitting a long time - they were flabby on their bottoms. So it's very much a mixed bag at this place. Too bad, because I remember when it was consistently good (not great, but they had good renditions of Mexican-American fare). Since it changed hands quite a few years back, things have gone downhill.
I love this place..The whole snapper with garlic is on point!  The staff is so friendly and accommodating.  The salsa has great spice.  Go eat here

Overall its a hit and miss kind of experience. A lot of the meats are too greasy, and their dishes are not seasoned that well in general. I do like their huevos con chorizo and the Alhambres, despite the caloric overload. Service is consistent and decent.

I went there last Monday night with my girlfriend and daughter. They have a very good kids menu. She the chicken tenders and fries that she enjoy very much. My girlfriend and I had the ground beef tostadas and dinner that was excellent. The guacamole was very well presented. And they have a full bar. The waitress and waiters. Were very friendly. The prices are reasonable. If you are a fan of mexican food and you are in upptown I recommend.

Went there last night with my girlfriend after a concert at the Riv because we were hungry. We sat at the small bar in back near the kitchen, our servers immediately put two waters and a hot basket of fresh tortilla chips and salsa in front of us. I ordered the 3 carne asada taco dinner (rice and beans) and a pepsi, my girl had the mini sampler. We knocked out the first batch of tortilla chips and without asking our server hooked us up with another basket of chips. The three tacos come with lettuce tomato and cheese, I had asked for onions and cilantro as well. The tacos were hot, fully loaded with meat and toppings, and they were delicious. We've come here a few times after concerts and I don't recall ever having a bad experience. I would definitely recommend Fiesta Mexicana!
Excellent burritos for the price. Cerveza in frosted glasses and a free kahlua and creme shot for dessert. Staff are helpful and the salsa is great.

I have been going to this place since I was 8. I am now 18 and I still love this place. My mom has also been going here since she was a kid, and she's 38 now lol I'll never stop going here. I LOVE their beef tacos and I'll always love them. EVERY TIME I go here I order the same thing lol I'll probably try something else, but overall it's a great place

2 stars for being edible, but that's it. Overpriced and the food just doesn't taste good. The chips were stale, my chicken tacos had no flavor (no cilantro, no onion, no lime) and my tortillas for the taco were barely warm and tasted gummy. Pass.
Stopped in for lunch. Very reasonable at $6.75 for a burrito, rice and beans, with a soft drink included. The food was good and the staff very friendly. Fun atmosphere.

The plan dinner, Mexican was the choice of food. A friend suggested this place and so we met up. First, off kudos to the staff they're friendly and eager to serve you. My meal was a disaster from the queso fondito and my lack luster fish taco dinner. The chips can use some work but that salsa is really good. As an appetizer I ordered to queso fondito it was greasy with no flavor and the cheese was really gummy like instead of bubbling and melty (foodie lingo) The Mexican egg rolls were interesting. A fusion of Mexican flavor and Asian design. Take something we are all familiar with and do a spin on it, very nice.  I ordered the fish tacos I love sea food and I saw some pix on yelp of the tacos. The presentation was nice and colorful but as picturois it was flavorful it was not. I took one bit and immediately thought someone unthawed fish sticks and served them in a warm corn tortilla. I notified my server he replied a lot of people like the fish tacos. My response was I guess I don't fall into that category. Then the server told me then it would be thrown in the garbage I assume that is where all horrible meals go to end. So I ordered two steak tacos figure if this doesn't get it there is no hope for this place.  The steak tacos come out finally a thumbs up. It was good but being from the westside and little village area there is definitely better Mexican food in the city. My companion order was wrong and we were given someone elses bill. I think she enjoyed her meal and that is something to be grateful. My next Mexican exploration will be south of the border of Uptown. Adios

This place is awesome. Talk about a bang for your buck. We got a pitcher of margaritas for like 20 bucks. Free chips and salsa and 2 shots of kahlua that are included with every meal!!  Defineatly will be coming back

Everyone loves Mexican cuisine. What's the point of going to Taco Bell, Chipotle, or Taco Burrito King if you can get great food at Fiesta Mexicana on Lawrence and Broadway?! One of my friends, Rosie, recommended me this restaurant because we had a conversation about where I can get good authentic Mexican food as well as good margaritas. My boyfriend and I decided to go there and see if what she was saying was true. Kris and I decided to judge this place based on food, beverages, the décor, and how well we were taken care of by the staff. After our experience we decided that it was very close to perfect and this is why. We went to Fiesta Mexicana last Saturday for lunch, and we were both starving since we didn't have breakfast. We walked over there because the weather was nice and once we got there we noticed that they had a little outside sitting area which was really cute. It was a little windy outside so we decided to sit inside anyway. The inside of the restaurant felt really homey. There are a lot of warm colors and there are a lot of decorations but everything blends in perfectly together to make the customers feel comfortable. The tables are not really close to each other even though the restaurant isn't big. The overall look of the restaurant is very appealing and once you walk in you know that you're in a Mexican restaurant and you expect the food to be good.  When we walked inside we were greeted by most of the staff with smiles on their faces and they let us sit wherever we wanted which we really liked. Once we sat down a nice men brought us some chips and warm spicy salsa which was delicious, and filled our glasses with ice water. Throughout our visit there when we didn't have any more chips and salsa he would walk over to our table and ask if we wanted more. After he left, our waitress came by and gave us our menus and few minutes to decide what we wanted to eat. Throughout our whole experience there she would always make sure that we were enjoying ourselves. The great thing was that she wouldn't come over every few minutes and bother us; she knew exactly when was the perfect moment to walk over to our table and ask how we were doing.  Like I said before, after we got our menus, our waitress gave us some time to decide what we wanted to eat. She came back after few minutes and for starters we ordered Mexican Egg Rolls and I ordered Margarita Con Sabor which was mango flavored and Kris ordered Margarita De La Casa. Our margaritas were served really fast and we had time to decide what we wanted for our main course while we waited for the appetizer. This is where the issue was. We waited for the appetizer and to order our main course for almost thirty minutes. While we waited for the appetizer to come, our waitress quickly came over and apologized for the wait; we just wished she would have taken our order while we were still waiting for our egg rolls. We finally got to order our main courses which were Enchiladas with pork for Kris and Chimichanga with chicken for me.  At the end the appetizer was worth the wait because it was really delicious! There were three big egg rolls cut in half with a lot of guacamole, salad, and pico de gallo.  They were really filling and extremely delicious. We waited for our main courses for a short period of time comparing to how long we had to wait for the appetizer. Both of our dishes were extremely delicious. My Chimichanga was perfectly fried and Kris' Enchiladas were perfectly cooked. We had to take most of our food to go because the Mexican Egg Rolls were extremely filling. We asked our waitress for two boxes and a check. First she brought us two boxes so we can pack our food and then she went to get our check. When she brought our check she also brought two complimentary shots of Kahlua with cream which once again were so delicious. She also apologized once again for the appetizer being late. At the end I left Fiesta Mexicana very satisfied, extremely full, and in a really good mood. The food was amazing, the drinks were great, the atmosphere felt homey, and we were treated with respect. So the overall experience was amazing even though we waited for our appetizer for a long time. I recommend this place to everyone who enjoys good Mexican cuisine and homey atmosphere. I guarantee that everyone will leave this restaurant satisfied and with full stomachs.

I order some chicken enchiladas and the tortilla was not good at all. After I got home from there I had to run to the bathroom.  I really don't recommend this place at all. To pricy for the quality of their food.

Your burritos are so soft and delicious that they make me feel safe; the type of safe you feel when you're mother holds you close at night. The margs get me very lit, and I like that a lot. Overall, this establishment is great and you should really pay a visit!

I ABSOLUTELY LOOOOOVE this place!!! The food AND customer service are AWESOME! Thus far, I ordered the Flauta Dinner, Burrito Dinner, Quesadilla Dinner, Sopes, Margarita Pitchers, and Margarita Single-Served Glasses and they were all great. I want to try one of their Red Snapper Dinners soon; I heard they were good as well. All in all, I would recommend this place to anyone in a heartbeat. My boyfriend thinks I am addicted :-D.
Can't be beat for post-midnight drunk food near Lawrence.

A Neighborhood Favorite for Authentic Mexican Fare- Fiesta Mexicana is a nice little dive for authentic sit down Mexican fare. The service is usually fairly quick, polite, and accurate and the food is good and authentic. The standouts here are the Queso Fundito, a warm gooey salty, mess of melted cheese that's as drool-worthy as it is heart clogging every night of the week, and the post dinner complimentary digestive shot if you dine in and order drinks. That last bit adds a bit of charm and fun to a meal out with friends.  The single major gripe with this little quaint uptown dinning spot is the price of certain dishes, if you aren't careful, dinner for even one can swell over $15 for a single person. In addition, this writer thinks of their rice and bean side dishes as "plain/bordering on flavorless" which reduce the overall value of this place as a quick easy meal.  That said, the portion sizes, for everything but their nachos tend towards the "too much food for one sitting" side of plentiful, especially if you order an appetizer and drinks.  If you're feeling like a margarita, they have a decent mix with some flavor options that come served in a nice earthen ware jug for a bit of authentic in your fiesta.  Aside from the aforementioned queso fundido, and post dinner shot, there isn't a whole lot to go out of your way for. If you are near uptown for jazz at the Green Mill two doors down, or hitting a concert at The Riv or Aragon, or even just craving good authentic Mexican for dinner, go for it, otherwise, don't go far out of your way for this place.
This place is great if you want authentic Mexican eats! I highly recommend the steak burrito with a side of Dos Equis and Tequila!

We love your food, but your girl delivering tonight, Sunday 1/25/15 has a serious attitude problem!  She  was rude and nasty and went to the wrong address on first attempt!  Wish I could take her tip back.

Never again. Pastor tacos were gross. You have to ask for corn tortillas. They were cold and I don't even think they tried to grill or cook them in any way. The pastor was dry. The chicken tortilla soup was flavorless.

Not too shabby! Went on a Sunday around 12:30 and was fairly empty but over time the place began to fill up. The salsa has some good spiciness to it. I ordered a basic quesadilla which was good and filling along with the rice and refried beans. The margaritas are delicious and may hit you with a sudden buzz. The complimentary shot of kahlua type shot is a perfect ending to your meal! Overall, it is not the most extraordinary but seems authentic so I would definitely go back again.
It's location is prime for post-can't concert food. Average food. Not too expensive. What we were looking for after a concert at the Aragon.

Went here before a concert and I enjoyed it, it seemed very authentic.  Cheap enough for a big city and they give you a lot to munch on so all in all I had no problems with the no-frills place, except I did get a little of that "sticky menu" vibe.

TERRIBLE! Don't order from here. I assume they are only still in business because they are open late. I had ordered delivery and it was $30 for 3 items. We got steak nachos, chicken tortilla soup, and Mexican egg rolls. First off, the $10 nachos had 8 chips and was covered in cheese and beans. They were so soggy it was disgusting to eat. They added hot sauce and guacamole on the side. The amount of grease that was in this order was absolutely appalling. See my photo I added if you don't believe me. The soup had melted cheese in the bottom and the only vegetables were potatoes and carrots. The veggies were cut so large I had to cut them to eat them. The cheese and avocado should have been placed on the side. The soup was rather, eh, kind of bland. Also, there was NO CHICKEN in the soup.  The Mexican egg rolls were the only thing worth offering. However, even these were terribly soggy and had absolutely no crunch.  I would NOT RECOMMEND this place to anyone. If you're looking to dine in and it's before 8pm, do yourself a favor and order from a better Mexican joint. The amount of money paid for the quality of food was not worth it. I will never order from here again.
Such great service we had. Food was fresh. I had the vegetable burrito. Refried beans are tasty. Salsa is yummy and they give you a complimentary shot of Kaluah and creme when you are finished.
This place has delicious Tortas. I have mine made vegan and they put a good amount of beans and avocado. Yum!

The lunch special can't be beat! They offer a large variety of choices for $6-$7. The portion size is large enough for most women to share. I ordered the tacos lunch portion that consisted of two tacos, rice and beans. Everything was delicious. There was so much that I needed a doggie bag. Our waitress was friendly and pleasant. The service was swift and efficient.  I'll definitely return.
Nice and quiet place, with good food. I've been there few times but I have to say Fish Tacos with mango salsa are outstanding, worth going just to try that dish. Everything else just average.
The food was delicious...we had the chicken and cheese enchiladas. Might be some of the best I've had in Chicago.

I enjoy this place for 3 reasons: 1.) fast and nice- the ppl here are sweet and fast. For some reason I am very hungry when I order from FM but they satisfy my hunger quickly and for that I am grateful.  2.) good mole. Not too sweet and not too bitter. Chicken mole enchiladas are good and the rice is never dry and for that I  grateful. Oh, you serve 'Rita's? I am now even more grateful.  3.) located next to The Green Mill. So when Kurt Elling pops in to town I can have my jazz and mole at the bar. And for that I am VERY grateful (plus I have an awesome husband who always makes the food run for me).

OK. OK. I MUST give an update because, since my last not so great visit to Fiesta Mexicana, I have fallen in love with their chicken tortilla soup! This soup is awesome! Really really good stuff! Their queso fundido is good too! Good enchiladas, but I wasn't so crazy about their steak burrito. If you like just steak or other meat and no lettuce, beans, tomato, onions and cheese and/or sour cream to be inside your burrito, then you probably will enjoy their burrito since their steak burritos are filled with only steak. I like it to be filled with the other things as well so I find their burrito to be kinda boring because it's basically just filled with meat only.

Food was fair but they can not be trusted.  My wife ordered on Grub Hub and said we would pay $ and pick-up.  I picked up the order and put it on a credit card.  When I got home, I compared my charge to my Grub Hub order and discovered a difference.  I called the restaurant and was told ' their menu has some different prices than Grub Hub and when paying cash, would be charged the higher restaurant price - no matter what my Grub Hub total shows'.  I called Grub Hub: they let me vent and handled my issue to my satisfaction.  I later checked a menu Fiesta Mexicana included with my order and saw their menu matched GH exactly - they simply added $ to my order.  Thank you GH for handling this and hello to the restaurants about to get what was Fiesta Mexicana's business.

The food is okay.  I haven't found a dish I really like yet, but I'm also from Southern California...so my standard of good Mexican is pretty high.  My friends like it, so we go often enough for margaritas, queso fundido and whatever we fancy.  Like I said, it's ok- just not great.

I live near Pilsen so if I really wanted to get some good mexican food, trust me... I'll find it. This place is close by to where I work so I tried it. The food is okay, nothing special. The service was average, okay. The atmosphere on the other hand, ugh... can be much better. The place looked kinda old, dark, small and kinda dirty. They really need to kick the decor and cleaning up a notch. But I do recommend the taco salad. I liked it.

This is a fun place to go to with company that is not fussed with presentation or decor. Food was good. We ordered the carnita and pastoalra tacos.  Really fast service but the pork was dry. Serving size is fair, but it lacked flavour. Price could have been a bit cheaper.   After eating at Big Star a few weeks ago I can't help but compare the dishes. Service was great and the patrons make it fun too!

Food is okay, Way overpriced. But most importantly bad customer service. They act like getting your food is an inconvenience to them to the point where I stopped coming in for lunch because it was so uncomfortable. On a side note a coworker ordered off of grub hub, and when she got there they demanded more money... If you charged the wrong price, you have to just bite the bullet rather than make someone fortieth their lunch or pay whatever price you come up with.
Great Margaritas, service was great and the Carne Asada was to do die for. It's hard to get a thin piece of beef cooked rare in the middle and be flavorful, this was both, just delicious.

This is a place I use to enjoy going to. The last visit I made the wait staff was rude and did not want to prepare the food as I ask, but last time it was no issue. As I was eating I bit into a large chunk of a chicken bone in the shredded chicken. Of course the waitress said sorry and went on, but had I gotten the chicken I ask for it to be, this would probable not happened. So will I be returning?? NO THANKS. There are many more Mexican restaurants in the city that I can give my business to.

Ordered me a chicken burrito, a beef taco, and some jalapeno poppers. It seems as if they like to pour this watery sauce on everything because it was covering my burrito and taco. The taco was sitting in a pool of it which made the crunchy shell turn to mush. I gave up on the taco. The burrito was the most disappointing burrito I have ever eaten! Again served in a pool of this sauce, the tortilla some how managed to survive it. When I bit into the burrito more sauced poured out. Bland tasting, beans were no flavorful. Chicken was bland. And the poppers, cannot forget about these. These were the best part and they were not even decent. I feel robbed for even spending my money here. DO NOT make the same mistake I did. Overall feeling: gross

I'm 37 years old, and I've been dining here since I was 8 years old. I stayed down the street on Clarendon and Wilson in the white twin towers. Since then, I moved to the western suburbs and will go out of my way to come here whenever I had a taste for some tacos.  I love their table salsa they serve with the chips. They are delicious, but their prices went up, the portions got smaller, and they are stingy with their toppings. If I asked for extra tomatoes and cheese, they will charge me almost $3. If I want a side of guac, it's almost $5! I will be their customer for life, but I wish they were generous on their portions like they were back in the day.

Fiesta Mexicana is my favorite Mexican restaurant in Chicago. Please allow me to explain: 1) Burritos. Their burritos are insanely delicious and relatively cheap. 2) Flautas. I love their flautas. I probably order them the most. Their perfectly crispy and the shredded chicken is really tender and flavorful. 3) Drinks. A pitcher of margaritas is cheap and they have a lot of good flavors but unfortunately no tamarindo so I usually go with guava. Also, you get free shots of amaretto with your check. That is tasteful! 4) Ceviche. Some of the best ceviche in the city. Always fresh and it holds up well even when you have it delivered.  I've had more lunches and dinners at Fiesta Mexicana than I can recall. I always leave full and happy. Check this place out for a fun night in Uptown or go by on Sunday for brunch.

I ate only half my fajitas expecting to eat the rest the following day. we ordered an Aguacate Relleno to go. while I waited I had ordered a hot chocolate. It took forever and the place was not crowded. No reason for the delay. eventually it came but never got the rest of my fajitas.  it seems the waiter tossed them in the garbage. Make EXPLICITY CLEAR to.them you want a doggie bag!!  it's. very anoying when this happens.   debating whether I'll. go back.or not.

I'll admit it, I'm not that picky about my Mexican food. Where I come from (rural California) I'm used to something satisfyingly greasy and flavorful served in large portions.  This is just what you'll find here. Go with the single serving tacos on the back of the menu. Order two if you're not starving, 3 if you are, 4 if you're gluttonous. The meats is served up on a double layer of soft corn tortillas. It's cheap, fast and tasty.  The chips are a bit of a weak point (I prefer airy corn chips) but the salsa is spicy and good.  It's good enough that I'm often tempted to jump off the El at Lawrence on my way home. Repeat visits are always a sign in my book.
Delicious! The portions are good, the prices are affordable, friendly service and it's the best mexican food in the neighborhood. Go for the pastor tacos or the aztec soup, you won't regret it.

I suppose the *only* plus-side of this place (and probably how they get most of their business) is that they're open late. I imagine that many of their patrons end up being concert-goers from the Riviera or Aragon who are hungry after their shows. Which is how I ended up here late last night with one of my friends. I sat next to a fax machine on a folding table and paid $4 EACH for two hard and dry lengua tacos served on soggy tortilla -- and what was up with the measly sprinklings of onion and cilantro?  And what is up with no tamales on the menu?
Just like the other reviews state, the margaritas are amazing! Get a pitcher, it is well worth a visit. Also had the sopes and they were delicious. Give it a try!
Was delicious. Loved the queso fundido. Food came quickly.

Needed some quick food before a concert and stopped here. Service was super slow and disorganized. And the food was pretty average. I had some tacos and while they were edible, I literally forgot about them an hour later. So go try another Mexican place!

My boyfriend and I just ate here for lunch.  We tried the single tacos, I had Carne Asada La Plancha, and he had Carnitas, and they were both great and full of so much meat we only ate one taco. The meat in the Carne Asada taco was big chunks of good steak, no fatty bits that you can sometimes get in steak tacos.  Really one of the best I've had. The guacamole was ok, it was good, but lacked a little umph, I think I might ask for it spicy next time to see if that kicks it up a bit.  The salsa was pretty great, I liked it.   And they give a shot of Amaretto after you're done eating, so it was very friendly!  Service was great as well, and lots of friendly people around that all talked about how they love the place and they've been going for years!

First visit, but we'll be back. Very good margurita, wonderful seafood/rice combination with mussels, shrimp, calamari -- large portion, wonderful, tasty, somewhat spicy, with enough for a second  meal at home.  (Can't recall, but I think it was s$11!)

Coming back from a long day of shopping in the burbs, we wanted something quick.  Our usual go to Mexican resto ran out of chicken. Really, they ran out of chicken.  So, we went to Fiesta Mexicana. We ordered chicken tacos, carne asada tacos and pork tacos. The chicken tacos were ok.  Not too much flavor.  The carne asada was decent.  The pork has pineapple or something sweet and fruity in it.  Kinda threw me off a bit.  It was ok.   Based upon that mean, not sure if I would go back anytime soon.  Prices and location were perfect.  But the food was just ok.  We also ordered chips and salsa.  The chips weren't salted enough but the salsa had a very nice kick.
The nachos were among the worst I have ever had.  I could not even finish them.   If a place can't even get nachos right....
I'd heard the margaritas were delicious and deadly.  Yes and Hell Yes.  Food was very good and very reasonably priced.

They do the fooda program at my old office building, and I will walk over there from my new building just for this. I salivate thinking about their tacos. I would really really really like them to deliver to me in the suburbs, b/c i crave them ALL THE TIME. *drool*

We went to this establishment after the Ellie Goulding concert at the Aragon.   The service was SUPER fast.  I ordered the fish tacos and in one word UH-MAZING!!!! we also had a burrito and enchiladas with green sauce, also very tasty. Chips and salsa good and the strawberry margarita ok as well.  Would definitely come here again.

Stopped in for a quick dinner before hitting the Green Mill. I thought it was decent.  The food was not out of this world, but for what we ordered it worked out just fine.  Split the Mexican Shrimp Cocktail which was really good and inspired me to try and replicate it at home. Sadly, mine didn't turn out that great. The restaurants was better. I like stuff served in sundae cups.  I ordered the Taco Salad. It was ok. Shell was a tad greasy, but I ate it. Service was decent. Location was great and close to our destination. We sat by the window which was a little drafty, but not a biggie. Worth a try.

This review is for take out only. I have never dined in the establishment. If you are ever in the mood for chicken tortilla soup, burritos, or chimichangas, this is the place. The soup has a little spice to it, which I love! Unauthentic? Yes. However, sometimes you need a good burrito.  Fast and courteous delivery every time.

This place has the best guac ever!  I love that this place is within walking distance and the food is delicious. It is standard mexican fare but the service is good, food is delicious and the drinks are strong. It a good neighborhood joint.

Fiesta has always been my favorite Mexican Restaurant. I have been going there for over 25 years. Their food is always consistent. The cons are their prices have gone up a lot and they are not too good at phone orders or delivery. Usually if I want take out I will order in person and wait to pick it up. Food is still excellent.

I helped a few friends polish off 3 (or was that 4? 5? ... things are a bit fuzzy) margaritas pitchers. They were affordable and knocked me on my ass. All I can remember is that services was A+. Our waitress was as sweet as sweet could be and all of the employees were very friendly. Fiesta Mexicana's patio is small, but comfortable. It's great for people watching. So grab a couple friends, grab a couple pitchers of margaritas, and enjoy the weather!

The food is always good at this restaurant and the service is tops...but, really..why not at least put a Mexican tequila in the drink? We were recently disappointed when we asked to upgrade the tequila in the Margarhita's we ordered...Regular price is a reasonable $8, but the upcharge to change the Jose Cuervo (which was not even listed as the tequila they used) to Don Julio, was $5, and $13 for a Margharita is Over-The-Top! Otherwise, a very good Mexican Restaurant that is open later than most.

We hadn't been in for quite some time, but with the required remodeling of our kitchen, due to water damage, we returned last week. I was surprised with how much the food has improved.  The menu is filled with all kinds of creative platters and combinations.  I opted for the tres colores (tricolor) enchiladas.  Extremely good!  The mole sauce at Fiesta is quite good and pairs well with the red and green salsas.  I've since return to have this dish again (Thanks, gutted kitchen!)   I'm very psyched to have good sit-down Mexican so close to my pad.

Think of it like you are at a sporting event. That .50 cent hotdog you paid $5 for Ok now were using our heads. Overpriced mexican food!!  You can get the same food quality at ANY mexican place in Chicago for half price! Unless you are stuck there  because of a show at one of the theaters around the corner or too tired to drive to one out a million 24hr mexijoints. Two people one sangria a buritto and a soso entree for $40.00!!!! Yes 40$$!!..!Remember they are right next to two theaters and in order to stay in business in that neghborhood is to rely on Overcharging as your only means of survival. Oh..The food was ahhh? SoSo didnt even take the leftovers.

I had a chicken and cheese enchilada...maybe its the margarita talking but they were gooooooooooooood!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Margarita was tasty too! I'm not a drinker but that I liked, flan was eh...but I'm planning to go back.

Fiesta Mexicana is a regular go-to spot in our neighborhood. Fiesta gets busy when there are shows and on weekends, so go during the week when things are a little quieter. Their service could not be better - friendly, reliable and fast! Overall, the food may not be the best Mexican you can find in Chicago where we have plenty of great options, but I have found no match for their margaritas on the Northside. If you're looking for a good meal, comfortable place and killer margarita after a long day at work, Fiesta is the place!

Fiesta Mexicana is a reliably good place that is perfect for picking up a carry-out order at 11PM when most other restaurants in the neighborhood are closed.   The Barbacoa tacos are excellent.  I seem to remember being told they were beef tongue, but don't let that deter you they are really good!  The pico de gallo, and the Carnitas tacos have always been good too.   For good food at 11PM on a Sunday, you really can't beat it.

Chicken enchiladas from here all day every day please! Service could be a little better -- we waited for our check for quite a while. It was a Saturday night, to be fair, but it was early, and the place was not super crowded by any means. Reasonable prices, decent food. Nothing super amazing, but not bad at all. I'd gladly go back if I was in the area (I was with my much younger cousin so no margaritas, or these Kahlua shots I've heard about?! -- which might equal an extra star), but wouldn't go out of my way.

I am embarrassed to say that Fiesta Mexicana has been my go-to restaurant for years. It's not the best place, it's not the worst place, but you really can't go wrong if you stick to its strengths. I've found over the years that late lunch is the best time to go, when all the braised dishes are being prepped for evening service. I tend to stick to the "super-tacos" (barbacoa or carnitas -- RIP the lamb), carne asada, carne adobado and guisado de puerco. Sopes are hit-and-miss as they walk a fine line between toothsome and break-your-toothsome. The fish dishes are surprisingly good, and the ceviche and whole fried snapper are especially popular during Lent. Please stick to the plain margarita, on the rocks with salt. The fruity flavors just make you look silly.

I was really surprised at how much I liked this place. The decor is a little cheesy (the most fake flowers I've ever seen outside a craft store) but who cares? It's fun. There's all the usual Mexican stand-by menu items. The margaritas are great, and we both really enjoyed our meal. The best part was that it was somehow cheaper than we thought, and for no apparent reason they gave my husband a free shot of some kind of liquor.

I live a block away from this restaurant, and have been here twice.  The most recent visit will be my last.  The service was fine-- not particularly friendly, but they took our order and brought our food. Also, the outdoor sidewalk seating is great when the weather's nice.  But the food has been abysmal both times I've gone.  On this most recent visit, I ordered the enchiladas, and their "ranchero sauce" was literally nothing more than canned tomato sauce-- not seasoned in ANY way whatsoever.  Also, the enchiladas weren't cooked through, and the cheese inside was still in its shredded form, and cold to the touch.  The prices would be reasonable if the food was palatable, but it's just not.  There are waaaaay too many good Mexican places in the city for me to come back here, even though it's so close by.

Interestingly, I have noticed most, if not all, of the really negative reviews are from folks that are going to or coming from a show at the Aragon or the Riv...   but not from someone that lives here and goes when there are NOT shows going on... .. I can tell you, I find the food pretty good, very reasonably priced and the Margaritas excellent and have no complaints. They service has always been good and friendly and this is our go-to spot if we just want to sit outside, have some dinner and a couple of margarita and  enjoy life... .. so maybe , if you are in a hurry along with 3000 other people, this is not set up for success that way... but if you are in the area any other time, I have no problems recommending it as a great little neighborhood restaurant

As nasty as ya hurrd. I am someone who can eat copious amounts of food. I have been known to shame, scare and impress with my ravenous hunger. I left these chicken nachos on the plate. Not even in a tired, hungry and semi-drunken state could I finish eating what was set before me. The chips were soggy. The meat was tough. The cheese was "ew-yuh." I don't think the other toppings were fresh as fresh can be. To add to this foolishness, chicken nachos + Jarritos soda = $12.  $12?? In Uptown? At a taqueria? What's Spanish for, "You got served, son!"? Ugh. If a hungry, greedy drunk won't eat your food... I don't think you're doing too well, FM.
Good food, close to music venues, friendly staff - you can't go wrong. It took a while for initial service, but it was overall a great experience.

Darn it.  I've been Flash Taco'd again!  Why does this keep happening? --- Flash Taco'd (v.): 1. To eat at a restaurant sober and realize that it should only be eaten at while drunk due to a severe lack of quality.  2.  To have an experience similar to one that would be had at Flash Taco in Wicker Park (see:  yelp.com/biz/flash-taco-… ). --- After years of hearing my friends rave about how great this place is *after* a show at The Aragon or The Riviera, I should have made an important assumption - that they were all drunk when they ate here.  And that, just like Flash Taco, the stunt of eating here should not be attempted sober. Ordering anyway, I was confronted with a choice of toppings on my enchiladas.  I wasn't feeling up to spicy, so I asked the server which was hotter.  He told me, "they're all mild."  And, yikes, did the ranchero sauce I chose ever meet that description.  Far from saving my palette from the heat, it was the kind of spaghetti sauce salsa that never fails to disappoint.  And the cheese inside my enchilada was of mozzarella stick quality and consistency.  Plus the rice and beans were dry. Maybe this was my punishment for only ordering water.  I can't believe that, when the only other customers seemed to be (possibly drunk) homeless people getting carry out, the server actually gave me attitude for this transgression. Looking around the restaurant, I was confused by the whole thing.  It didn't look like the low quality Mexican lunch counter I was experiencing.  They were showing videos as opposed to soap operas.  The seats were comfortable.  There was attractive (albeit stereotypical) art on the walls.  And there was even a fully stocked bar.  I mean, were I drunk, I might have mistaken this for an actual quality Mexican restaurant! But I wasn't.  And if I want substandard Mexican, I don't need to wait until after a show in Uptown to get it.  The "real" thing is too nearby my apartment.  And I refuse to be Flash Taco'd by any place but Flash Taco!

I had a craving for tacos Al Pastor and against my better judgement, decided to try out Fiesta Mexicana.  The tacos were fine, as was the flan - but the price did not match up.  I know the portion sizes were generous, but the food did not have the zing I was looking for.  Apart from the food, the place is packed with small tables, meaning that I had to get up several times during my meal to let people get to and from their tables.  Not fun at all.  Not going back.  Not when I can think of at least two other places within a few minutes drive from there.

My boyfriend and I ended up eating at Fiesta Mexicana by chance. We had just left the Aragon Ballroom and were hoping to get something quick before heading back to our hotel we knew we were both starving and didn't want to waste too much time searching out the perfect restaurant so when we walked by Fiesta Mexicana and saw that there wasn't much of a wait, we decided to take our chances. The most surprising thing about Fiesta Mexicana was how courteous and attentive the staff was. Even though the restaurant was jam packed, we were brought chips, salsa, and water immediately after being seated, our waited checked on us throughout the night, frequently refilling our water glasses, and our check was brought promptly after we were finished eating. I had the enchiladas tres colores and was pleasant surprised by the combination of sauces (especially the tomatillo sauce.) The rice and beans were also excellent. I can see why some people might complain about the food being bland, the flavors were definitely understated (aside from the salsa, which was spicier than I'm used to), so if you prefer spicier dishes, you may be disappointed. I tend to like my food on the mild side, so it was just right for me. Fiesta Mexicana was perfect for what my boyfriend and I were looking for: a quick, delicious, moderately priced late-night meal.

Pretty normal, almost order by number Mexican food. Not bad, not great. This was a quick stop when Carmela's was closed, and it did the job, but I don't know if I would hanker to return. I ordered something pretty gringo - the chimichanga, but it was still fine. The ground beef was seasoned well enough, and the portion was certainly enormous. They also had Mexican hot chocolate (the brand I'm familiar with is Ibarra) which was really nice on a very cold day. They day I was their, the salsa was a little better than what I would normally expect, so that was nice. Service was a little bit slow, prices are a little bit high for specials, but I can forgive it. It's a good backup, but I don't know if I would be back. as a first choice.

Kind of a ho-hum Mexican place.  I ate here twice recently while waiting for a concert at the Aragon Ballroom.  The first thing I noticed was that the combinations and dinners were quite expensive (~$12 for a typical combination plate).  Between my two visits, I tried the steak burrito and ground beef tostadas.  Neither were all that spectacular, although they weren't bad either.  I found myself wanting the little things I look for at certain Mexican places (a second tostada shell, fresh tomatillo sauce, etc.)  For some reason, the rice tasted like I was eating pennies, but that was my only flavor gripe.  The chips and salsa were quite good (the three of us went through two bowls of each). The service was very good though, the food came out very quickly and everything was exactly as we had ordered.  Their menu is pretty extensive and they have a plethora of different alcoholic beverages and margaritas to try.  If you want a nicer sit-down type Mexican joint, this it probably the best bet.  If you want some really good Mexican food, I'd go to Carmela's around the corner.

I've been visiting this place for several years. This is neither a high-end restaurant or a quick taco joint. They do have very good food at a reasonable price.  The enchiladas with plantain filling and mole, the empanadas, and the fish tacos are all excellent. The margaritas are another selling point--they are good, and cheap. I've always been happy with the service.  The music is sometimes a bit loud, and the seating area is too small for large groups, so keep that in mind. They do have outdoor seating in summer.

Excellent service, Good food. A little pricey. The only problem I had with the place was that it was rather cold with the door opening up alot. If you seat close to the door it tends to be cold. Try this place in the summer with the outside seating and you won' t have to worry about the draft. Very Clean!!!!!!!
The food here is pretty good but really pricey for Mexican food. The service is often very poor and slow. I only eat from here if I've been craving Mexican for a long time.

Fellow yelper, Bryan C. and I come here often to begin a night on the town.  Sometimes a pitcher of margarita and some guacamole is all you need.  The margaritas are strong and delicious.  Five stars for those.  The rest of the menu is really just ok, but I can get down with the veggie burrito (the one with the actual vegetables in it, not just beans and cheese) from time to time.

I'm really surprised by the bad reviews I'm reading here; the one thing they all seem to have in common is people eating really late after drinking at one of the local bars.  I've been coming to Fiesta Mexicana 1-4 times a week for over a year now, and I love it.  I haven't had a bad meal, the service is quick, the staff knows me now, and they've been working on new items all the time with a renewed focus on quality and presentation.  The Azteca Chicken Tortilla soup is heavenly, the Mexican Jambalaya inspired, and the enchiladas are always comforting and delicious.  Also I am straight addicted to their complementary chips and salsa.  I don't drink margaritas so I can't personally speak to their quality, but my girlfriend gets them all the time, and she's never had a problem. For people complaining about the filling in their burrito or chimchanga, I suggest you read the menu - you get exactly what is described there.  I'm not sure why the burritos only consist of meat and beans, but you shouldn't come here expecting Chipotle (or, God forbid, Taco Bell -- did you really say "Fourthmeal?").  This is a quality restaurant that rewards trying unusual items, and if you are coming late-nite and drunk I recommend any of the Combination plates - they'll fill you up and they're delicious.

Their margarita and their chimichanga is expensive and horrible.  At first the visit seemed great. A concert had just let out and it was a busy place! I walked in with my friend and we were seated right away with pleasant faces. Initially we noticed that their menu is very, very much overpriced, especially for the quality. I suppose it can be if you prey on the drunken and hungry late-nighters who have nowhere else to go. Unfortunately we became the prey and decided to pay the price.  Nearly eleven bucks for a basic chimichanga with a small scoop of bland rice, re-refried beans with a dab of guacamole and lettuce on the side. It tasted like, maybe, 6 bucks. I had also ordered a margarita, which they  kindly brought right out. I took a sip and thought it must be my imagination, but this tastes like dirty dishwater. I had my friend taste it and he agreed that it was the worse margarita he had ever tasted, so I sent it back.  When the bill was brought to us the margarita was still on it. I asked to have it taken off and the server kindly left and mentioned it to who seemed to be the manager behind the counter. She eventually, I mean eventually, brought the bill and explained that "we serve plenty of margaritas and this one was no different." Until this point we were enjoying the atmosphere and even having good conversation with the table next to us. Then I kindly explained that I would pay the (at this point I looked down and saw the price) $8.00 ($&@!!!) for the drink, but I wouldn't be back. She said "That's fine." We left, and I paid the price for the drink. I will never return.

We found ourselves in search of some sustenance at 2 in the morning. Lo and behold, we see a  neon "open" sign that elicited an angelic "aaaahhh". We ordered a half pitcher of sangria (which came with way too much ice) and a variation of tacos and burritos. Given the starved state I was in, I got the chicken torta ( I am a sucker for avocado betwixt crispy buns with heaps of chicken and refried beans). I thought that for a pollo torta, it would make sense that they'd showcase the chicken. Instead, I tasted more refried beans. Regardless, I ended up INHALING the sandwich. I thought that the food was alright. If it's late, you're in the area and craving a semblance of mexican, this place would make a decent pit stop.

I have Yelped a lot of places but I do not get up to Uptown much so when my friend suggested Mexican in Uptown I was game! It was Margarita Pitchers for $18 bucks so we decided to partake and it was well worth it. I ordered the steak tacos and they were A-OK. I thought everything was fresh and the place was clean. Living in El Paso for three years I have definitely had some good Mexican food but it was pretty decent I would definitely go back if I am ever up that way.

I order this for delivery and have dined in a few times on their patio. The combination Fajitas are so amazing. So far it's my favorite restaurant for  Mexican food. Margaritas are great too. Friendly service, nice patio.

So after our foray at the Wild Pug, we swung by Fiesta Mexicana for some food. FOURTHMEAL, as I call it. I needed some sweet quesadillas, STAT. I'm ashamed to say that I ate two dinners this night. Anyway, we were seated right away. As we looked over the menu, I had a resounding WTF moment. WHY ARE THE PRICES SO HIGH. I think they are depending on people being drunk (from the Wild Pug) and not caring how high the prices are, because they want Mexican food, dammit. But I wasn't THAT drunk. $8 for an appetizer quesadilla and $8 for jalapeno poppers is really steep. Come on. Fajitas are $21, which is insane. Our food came. My quesadillas were fine, but they certainly weren't worth $8.  I ate shame. And guilt. Tasty, sour cream and guacamole doused greasy guilt. The food was fine but I wouldn't come back here, most likely. There are other (better) Mexican joints that cost a fraction of the price.

Super disappointed in what was delivered to me based on the menu description.  Delivery was here in about 30 minutes. They were fast, I'll give them that, they were fast. Maybe if they were a little slower though I would have got what they described in the menu.  $6.00 for the " Azteca Chicken Tortilla Soup" - A chipotle chicken broth w/ avocado, cheese, tortilla strips, cilantro, sour cream, & shredded chicken.  Lets see...  Shredded chicken - nope.  Cheese - nope.  Sour cream - nope.  So $6 for broth, avocado, tortilla strips and cilantro. Ridiculous that half of the items listed were missing. I may be sick, and therefore cranky, but I still expect that what I read to match what I am delivered.  Chips and guac were good, but overall I fell like this was pretty expensive for the same quality you get from some of the other Mexican delivery in the area. Actually, I take that back, the quality would have been the same if half of the items that were supposed to be in my soup were actually in my soup.

I want to like it. It's so close to my house. The service was fantastic, best waiter ever really... But YUCK. I'm sorry, it was not good and not only was it not good, it's expensive! I had the tacos, my husband had a burrito. The burrito was like...meat and beans...that's it. My tacos were fine but not really. All the way home my husband had to spit by the cemetery because of the awful taste in his mouth. Our bill was close to 40$. For two people for some quick and spitty mexican food? Nope. Garcias on Lawrence all the way, better food at half the price. But again, GREAT waiter.

If I wanted an onion and cilantro taco with traces of lengua - that is what I would have ordered. $11.00 for two tacos and a horchata.  Quality sinfully bad. Price way over the top. This place used to be good - not it is not. Maybe because it was a to go order and they knew I'd be gone and couldn't call them out for not putting lengua on my taco. Not to worry - I am done with this joint.

This place sucks.  Just so it's not a throw away review I will add that the service was horrible and the food tasted like it was heated in the microwave in the back. I understand plenty of Mexican is passable when wasted walking out of the Aragon or the Riviera but at least show some effort. Don't go here after a show, Fat Cat a few doors down has some good beer and people and pretty good food.

The Aztec Chicken Tortilla Soup is amazing! I've had the seafood soup, which was very good and I usually always order the enchildas, which I love. This is not high-end Mexican, but for local diner food, I consider it somewhat upscale. The prices are reasonable, but if they were a little lower, I'd eat there more frequently than I already do. Vince is one of the best waiters in the world in my opinion. But overall, the staff is serious and do a great job and help each other. My only complaint is once in awhile the music is too loud and noisy like MTV.

I feel so contrarian when I slam a place as popular as Fiesta Mexicana, but I know I'm right.  There are a dozen better (and cheaper) Mexican restaurants within a mile of here.  I ate at Fiesta many years ago and vaguely recalled not being impressed, but I went again last night, at the request of a friend.  If I had said, "How about Cuetzala Gro instead?" I wouldn't have this vague pain in my stomach 15 hours later.  There was a bone in my chicken enchilada, and the mole sauce was the weakest, blandest, dullest mole I have ever had.  I thought it might have been ranchera, and asked the waitress if she had gotten my order right.  Fiesta Mexican is to mole as Pizzeria  Aroma is to poutine.  Wrong.  Embarrassing.  Shameful. Considering that prices are a bit higher than comparable Mexican places, I should have felt it was a terrible waste when my tummy rejected this "food" an hour or so later.  But I was relieved to be rid of it.  Lesson relearned.

I think this place is great.  I usually drop in after a show at the Riv or a night of drinking to get some food to go.  The food here is great.  The prices are a bit higher than the spot around the corner, but the later hours make this a great spot for a stack of  good Mexican food after a show since Carmella's is closed.  There's also more space to stretch your legs here.  The workers here are very nice and I think my favorite experience here was on Halloween-everybody was dressed up.  Good stuff!  Drop in & fill your belly.

I eat at this restaurant on a regular basis and have never had a bad meal. In fact, I had gotten to the point that I wouldn't order anything but the #13, a phenomenal combination plate of the most tender and flavorful skirt steak you will ever put in your mouth, paired with a to-die-for chile rellano. It's an orgasm on a plate.  Today, however, I was feeling adventurous and decided to try the fish tacos for a change. WOW! Just WOW! I have tried several versions of this dish around the city, and was beginning to think I would never find one that pleased my palate. The tacos arrived and I knew I was in for a treat. They had a perfectly crispy coating and were served with only a mango salsa, which was amazingly fresh and perfectly zippy. The chipotle tartar sauce was absolutely delicious, and I was in heaven. Fiesta Mexicana on Broadway is by far my fave Mexican restaurant in Chicago, and now I have another awesome dish to put into rotation.

Ordering in was a good experience.  I ordered two different appetizers and found both to be both tasty and plenteous.  The mini-chimi's had plenty of heat, and were surprisingly big for mini's.  The other appetizer was a "combo" platter with mini tacos, quesadilla etc.  I also like that they aren't cheap with all the yummy side sauces and moles.   While I probably wouldn't eat in, ordering in again is a distinct possibility.

Not a great part of town, but it's getting better.  Don't come here for the ambiance or decor, it's got plastic table cloths (I think). But definitely bring a crowd and order all the various types of Huachinango's they serve.  I love them all. Con tamatillo, al mojo de ajo, etc.  It's some of the best I've tried anywhere. I really haven't ordered much else from here, but when I'm in the mood for some fried red snapper, it's the first place that comes to mind!

My Saturday night tour of Uptown began here for dinner with 4 of my friends.  Two of us arrived early and, since the place was pretty packed, tried to reserve a table.  We weren't really sure who to talk to or how to go about this, but we grabbed one of the staff members and were able to get them to set us aside a table.  We could not have had better timing since 2 minutes later a group of 8 walked in.  Fortuantely they sat at the counter area! The walls were colored gold and full of fake flower vases and lights and decorations and everything.  The tableclothes were colorful and protected by a plastic barrier, similar to the ones Grandma's put all over their furniture in the "living room" to protect from spills, stains, handprints, children, etc.  Quite the color/pattern combo going on in here. Our server brought us some chips and salsa and we put in an order for a small pitcher of the house margarita.  The salsa was awesome - spicy, hot, deliclious, fantastic.  The 1/2 pitchers of margaritas came out in white pitchers with strawberries on them, adding to the randomness of design.  Tasty margaritas - and definitely worth splitting a pitcher with someone instead of ordering 2 a la carte.   Once everyone arrived we took a look at the menu.  To be honest,  I wasn't too crazy about it, and saw a couple things on there that caused me to do a couple double-takes.  Enchiladas with AMERICAN cheese?  Not very Mexican to me.  The taco platter was all beef tacos and offered no substition of chicken, cheese, chorizo, etc. unless you ordered individually?  Too much hassle.  I was torn between the taco platter and the blackened chicken southwest salad on special, but went with the former since it would go easier with a night of booze.  The food tasted great, though I would have liked to have thrown a chicken taco into the mix. Half of a half pitcher (so 1/4??) later I was feeling a-OK and ready to get the show on the road down the street.  All in all, not a bad experience.  Not sure when I'll be back - maybe when I'm touring the area north of Wilson again or if I happen upon their Lincoln Park location.

This place was a surprise to us, because it kind of looks like a dive from the outside.  We've been here 3 times and the food has never let us down-- we especially liked the tortilla soup and seafood nachos.  Their margaritas have a good amount of tequilla for the money, and once we were even treated to a complimentary after-dinner shot.

I've seen this place driving by many times and finally stopped in over the weekend. The decor is pretty cheesy but lots of fun. The drinks are strong and tasty. The food was really good and came in large portions, however it was a bit pricey for typical Mexican fare.  My boyfriend had the carne asada and is still raving about it 2 days later. I had the fish tacos and they are some of the best I've ever had!  Our favorite surprise of the evening was the shots of very yummy coffee chocolately liquor that came with our bill.  We'll definitely be visiting again!

There are a few things that I have learned about going out with a group that I like to call the Crazy Croatian Crew: 1.  Always eat before! 2.  Never pre-lube and drink almost the entire bottle of Cava. 3.  Don't expect to sleep until after at least 10 am the next morning. 4.  Much like the rules of survival, if you're taken to the second location, you're dead (drunk!!) On such an evening with the CCC, I had already violated rules 1, 2, and 4 and was in need of some food.  FAST!!  And so a friend and I ran off to Fiesta Mexicana for some grub before the second location. The steak tacos were good.  The beef tacos...not so much.  The "half pitcher" of sangria was huge and not something that I needed to be drinking at 3am.  No one in Fiesta Mexicana cares if you salsa dance in the middle of the dining room at 3am.

Yum...and there's a lot where that came from. If you're looking for a late night joint where the portions are huge this is a great option. You can sit at the counter (yes they do have those fun little swivel stools) or at a table (you'll practically be eating in your neighbors lap) and be prepared to enjoy some pretty spicy salsa. I enjoyed my empanadas with 3 to a serving you can try one of each (though the cheese and beef ones were my favorite) plus some beans and rice. If you're looking to quench your thirst they do have a selection of beers and of course margaritas. I was pleasantly surprised when our server brought of a shot of kahlua with our bill. What a great way to end the night!

I really like this place. Started going because I live walking distance from it. The staff are very friendly and the food is good. They have a huge variety of items. The "premium" margarita is very good.

I wanted to give this place three stars, I really did, but the food here could be a lot better.  In a town with so many Mexican restaurants, your grub has to be better than ordinary.  The service was prompt and generally pleasant (if not all that professional), but the grub was no more than acceptable.  I don't think that I'll return for another visit.  Sorry!

I stumbled upon this mexican place when a friend and I were looking for new places to eat in my new neighborhood and well, once when I was looking for some drunk munchies (no gonna lie). The food is good as are the margaritas. Typical mexican food was good and fairly priced, family setting. It was open when I wanted food at 1am which was great. The place is small but cozy and the service is good. Staff will answer any questions you have and ask you if you would like mild salsa with your complimentary tortilla chips.

The food is good, in a standard kind of way, and the margaritas are always strong. The negative here is really the space: one long room, with an aisle and seating to each side. It's not cozy or comfortable.   The positive: its a holdover until the Lincoln Ave. location reopens.

I am giving Fiesta Mexicana 5 stars simply based on their Margaritas alone.  They are the best ever.  They are so tasty and so strong and the perfect way to begin a night out on the town.  Get a pitcher!  Now, their food is like a 2 star, maybe 3 star.  Well, their food is not good, but for some reason, I love this place!  Oh wait! Their guac is really good.  So, go there and get an order of guac and a pitcher of margarita and it's a 5 star experience. Plus, it's a really fun place to be, it's a great place for a group of friends and the servers are nice.

I adore this place.  It's walking-distance from my friend's house and so we visit on a regular basis.  They're food is always phenomenal, their service is great, and if you order any alcoholic beverage (I recommend a full-pitcher of margaritas to share) you get a desert shot with your check (I believe it's Kahlua and chocolate or something... not sure... but delicious). The only thing that's better than good booze?  More booze. They often play Latino music with cheesy music videos on the television in the corner and this is arguably my favorite part.  They're hilarious and just get funnier with every sip.  They also have a front deck area so you can eat outside when it's nice.  Love, love, love.

I had a serious craving for Mexican food.  Once again, Yelp led me the right way.  I wanted something close to home and FM is right in my hood. I don't really have much to say about this place.  I mean, it is standard Mexican fare, cheesy decor, etc., but what I really need to tell you about is an apparent addition to the menu, which is the Azteca Tortilla Soup.  Hot Damn!  This is the best soup ever!  Slices of avocado, tons of cilantro, crispy tortilla strips and a huge scoop of sour cream.. I was bowled (ha..see what I did there! :-P ) over with how good it was.  Folks, it is a good thing that there is a concealed carry law in Chicago, because otherwise I would've held this joint up to get that recipe.  I also had a beef taco and a tamale, both of which were really not so good but I am willing to overlook that based on how good that soup was. I also had a margarita on the rocks.  The drink was filled with ice and I could see the condensation on the glass but it never tasted cold.  I'm no scientist but I am assuming this has something to do with the alcohol content?  Either way, I got a good buzz which is what I was going for.  Like my father says, "It doesn't matter when you are drinking for effect."  I love that man. I think I will be jonesing for that soup so I'm sure a return trip is in my near future.
i like this place they have a delicius micheladas the service is ok and the food to  i love the flan not to sweet .

I have been to Fiesta Mexicana Grill quite a few times and somehow just figured out the name! Well shame on me. I am ashamed (to prove it I just smacked my own hand!) I love Fiesta Mexicana Grill for two reasons. I LOVE the chile rellenos, they are so authentic and fresh and they have the most amazing jalapeños, yes jalapeños. I suggest ordering the trio of chile rellenos, mini chimichanga and mini burrito. If you enjoy spicy foods I also suggest adding the jalapeños to your dish. I don't know what makes the jalapeños special but let me tell you, they are special. Perfectly fresh and spicy! Another great thing about Fiesta Mexicana is the service. Don't forget your margarita!!

This place is full of nothing but sass! Sure the food is good....and yes the sangria's will make you forget to behave yourself....but the waitstaff needs to get a grip.  I brought my friend out to this place for her birthday the other day and she ordered the enchilada dinner. Apparently she had been there previously and known that they came with three types of sauce toppings. All of which were added to each enchilada. She asked for them to be separate (as she had ordered it in the past).....and the waiter said...."Oh no...they can't do that." She said, "Really? Cause I was here last week and they did." He kept saying, "No...no...the chefs won't do that" It was a matter of changing the direction that put the sauce on the fricken enchilada!!!!!! It was clear that the waiter just did not want to be bothered with asking the chefs to change the order in the slightest. This man was going to make me shake him vigorously. Honestly. I may go back for drinks sometime, but I'm going to insist on never having that waiter again. SASS!!!!

i was feeling OK about my meal here until i ventured to the restroom. you practically have to walk through the kitchen to get to the bathroom - while walking past, you can get a view of your quesadilla being microwaved. :(  the clincher was the large stack of sweating, oily, gag-inducing boxes clearly marked "LARD" piled onto the floor.

Last night at Fiesta Mexicana, we experienced some of the worst service I've experienced at a restaurant in awhile. There are too many good Mexican restaurants nearby to tolerate bad (and rude!) service. Basically, we walked into the restaurant and asked if we could sit outside. A server said that we could, if a table was available. We said there was a table available, but that it needed to be bused/cleaned. He said he would "try" to send someone out. We sat out there for approximately 5 minutes. When someone finally came to bus the table, he didn't greet us, and just cleared the dishes (with our help!). He didn't even wipe the table off, or give us menus. Then we waited for another 10 minutes or so, and watched the server we had talked to when we entered come out and check on other tables, though he still did not even stop by our table to give us menus or take drink orders. Totally unacceptable. We got the impression that since it was close to 9pm on a Monday night, maybe they were intentionally ignoring us, so that we would leave? Well, we did leave. We'll never go back there. And, I'm posting this negative review on Yelp. I hope they got what they wanted. Don't waste your time with this place, people. Go to El Mariachi on Broadway near Irving Park. Food and service are MUCH better!

I go to Fiesta Mexicana with one of my girlfriends at least once a week. Ask for Daniel--he's by far our favorite server. There's never a wait (at least when we go), and they pretty much stay open until people decide to leave. We've been there until after midnight some nights. Now the reason I put 4 stars vs 5 is because we order the exact same thing every time. We get a pitcher of regular margaritas on the rocks, enchiladas with verde sauce (I get chorizo and one cheese), and the guacamole appetizer. Their enchiladas are amazing, their margaritas very strong, and the guac is spectacular and enormous. And at the end of every meal, you get a complimentary shot of Kahlua and cream. I have no idea how their other food is because I admit once I discovered the enchiladas I haven't strayed. My boyfriend says that the burrito is not his favorite, so it may not have the best food in Chicago, but it is quite fantastic as a neighborhood spot to hang out, have a drink (or few) and have a great time in a low-key place (plus the music videos they play are HILARIOUS).

I vacillated between 3 and 4 stars on this one and in the end decided to give them the benefit of the doubt, with a 4. Pretend Yelp allows half-stars, and this is really a 3.5. Gracias! Someone else mentioned the [lack of] seating process. You walk in and there is no host station or sign or anything. It's not clear who you're supposed to talk to for seating, or if you can seat yourself (you can't). Last time I was there we stood around by the door for several minutes before an employee appeared (from outside, oddly) to seat us. But after that our party of 5 was seated quickly. The service is average, or maybe a little above. Water glasses were refilled regularly which is a big thing for me. What? I'm hydrophilic, OK? Nothing is worse than biting into a steaming hot and/or spicy piece of food, only to realize there is nothing but a couple of ice cubes in your glass, trying to look inconspicuous. But I digress. The food is pretty good here as well. The pechuga de pollo was tasty, but not the best I've had. Their fajitas are HUGE. I mean, HUGE. I'm not sure about the restaurant's policy on sharing them, but they could feed two average people. They are a bit juicer than what you find at most places (as in liquid in the skillet) but they are flavorful. And unlike some places I can think of (I'm looking at you, Uncle Julio's) they are generous with veggies, specifically peppers, onions & tomatoes. Prices can be a bit on the high side for non-fancy Mexican food, but again..the portions are quite generous. I haven't partaken, but they have reasonably priced margarita pitchers that my friends seem to enjoy. Also, as a special thank you for dining with them, they bring you a little complimentary shot of Kahlua & cream to wash down your meal. All in all not a bad place to get a bite to eat--OK a big bite--if you're in the area to see a show (at the Riv or the Aragon) or check out the Green Mill.

Let's be real. The only reason a person from California entered here was because the Green Mill doesn't serve food.  I ordered, of course, chicken wings, which were straight up the ones I make at home - Tyson's Barbeque Style Chicken Wings.  Why am I ordering chicken wings from a Mexican restaurant? Why are there chicken wings on the menu of a Mexican restaurant?  Why do they serve coffee? Do mexican restaurants  usually serve coffee?  I don't know.  I just wanted my food so I could go back and enjoy the sweet sounds of the Kimberly Gordon Organ Trio.  Kudos to the convenience; not so much for the chicken wings.  BTW, my friend scarfed down his burrito, but that's because he had the munchies.

Fantastic Margaritas! Food was pretty good - At least the meats used seem to be of high quality and were prepared perfectly! Good ambiance, and friendly wait staff! Prices were right on for service and quality! Loved it!
we got this for delivery.  not super slow.  the guacamole was good.  the rice was dry,  and my friend's beef burrito was full of fat.  not pleased overall.

My experience at Fiesta Mexicana on Broadway was not only extrememly disappointing, but it was by far the worst experience I have ever had dining out. My girlfriend and I had never been to this Fiesta Mexicana, but she said that she knew many people from nearby businesses who frequent the restaurant. So, we decided it looked cute and we should give it a try. We walked in and waited inline at the entrance, which means we were standing in the full dining room.
