We discussed just going and dining at the bar since there was room there, but figured the wait would not hurt. We were in no hurry. An employee of the restaurant cleared a table, walked over to us and guided us to the table.We sat down(like normal people do when they are sat at a restaurant.) Within second a male server abruptly came over to our table and interrupted our just settling conversation. He informed us that we could not just seat ourselves. When we tried to explain that we had been sat by an employee of the restaurant, he countered by telling us that others were ahead of us waiting at the bar for a table and from what he saw, we had sat oursleves. Now either this man is legally blind or the two of us were simultaneously hallucinating. He continued to inform us that there are rules at this place and that we would need to get up and wait our turn. We were shocked by this neandrothal's demeanor. In all of the years that I worked waiting tables to put myself through college, I had never seen customer service as inexcusable as this. i understand exactly what his job entails and we had not been rude or insubordinate in any manner. We got up and took our place back at the door, but were so repulsed that we chose not to stay. We got some air and returned to notify the manager of the employee's lack of skills in the field in which he was working. The manager feined concern, and told us that there had been people waiting at the bar, which was irrelevent at this point. Her staff had seated us. We are not psychic. We were not aware that other people were waiting for a table. It is not our job as guests at a restaurant to view the waiting list, organize a seating chart and communicate with our co-workers. For the sake of Uptown's Fiesta Mexicana, the food there better give the diner's orgasms because the management and staff are considerably lacking.

You know how when you go to most mexican joints in the city, and you get steak tacos/burritos, you get those crisped little cubes of beef? Now I'm not knocking crispy beef cubes, but Fiesta Mexicana skips those altogether.  They do this by using real cuts of good beef. Beef that's tender.  Beef that's tasty. This place has fast, friendly service, high quality food, and and doesn't cost more than any other place you've been in the city.  I'd say it's the best Mexican you can find in this neck of the woods.

I went here after hitting up the greenmill which is a couple doors down, and i was starving! unfortunately the prices are quite high, $10 for a burrito? come on... and the food was mediocre at best.  The service was ok, took a while to get ANYONES attention when we wanted the check, i basically had to stand up and wave my arms around to get anyone to pay attention to us.   so when we get the check, what do we find out? every additional basket of chips they gave us, they charged for it! they offered the first couple of times, and never mentioned that there was an extra charge, that is rediculous! I'm sorry but i will definitely NEVER come back to this restaurant again, to sum it all up, if you want expensive, mediocre mexican food, sure eat here, otherwise go elsewhere, spend half the amount, and get some good mexican food.

Mediocre Tasting Mexican Food.  Overpriced.  The Picadillo tasted like it was from a can! No flavor!  Again I must mention this place it neither priced well or tasty.  They charge for chips!!! I have never been to a Mexican place that does that!!!  Overall a BIG MEH.

meh, meh and more meh.  salsa is hot, but suspiciously 'frank's hot sauce-y' hot. everything was severely undersalted and generally underseasoned.  individual items were cheap (tacos, tortas, enchilladas, etc.) but the meals were fairly pricey for a taqueria. service was adequately friendly but painfully slow. summary: there are much better taquerias out there. take a pass on this one.

Crowded, small, no hostess to filter the people at the door, so when it's cold, the door opens and the wind comes in... And people bunch at the door. I'm only giving it 3 stars because they're one of the few places in town with good margaritas AND good food (at least at their other location they did). My husband and I actually left because it was too crowded, and no one greeted us, and we didn't want to be that two top by the door...   Too much hassle to get there, especially by car... limited street parking and bad traffic in the area.    PLEASE REOPEN YOUR LINCOLN LOCATION, FIESTA MEXICANA! We miss you!!

I love the food here.  I'm a musician and play at the Green Mill next door often and usually eat here at some point in the evening.  Great table salsa, tostadas de guacomole, taco lengua, ceviche are all tasty and fresh.

For some reason, for the love of my good friend, I decided to go to Uptown to Fiesta Mexicana to meet her for dinner last night. I used to live in Uptown, in fact, right down the street from FM. Uptown was a shiteous neighborhood to live in. I got a taste of the good ol' days when I walked up to FM and managed to have 2 homelesses ask me for change within 3 minutes. That's what living in Uptown is like. You go to your car in the morning and have a homeless skitzo meth addict asking you for 50 cents. Get outta here! (I'm heartless). Fiesta Mexicana is alright. The salsa is tastey but god damn are the margaritas expensive! We got 2 half pitchers and that cost $32! But, I guess FM is about a lot of things. Overpaying for your quesadillas, getting kinda drunk and sharing your deepest, darkest secrets and then receiving a complimentary after dinner shot of Kahlua and creme.  But at the end of the day, I'd rather eat Chipotle.

Fantastic margaritas, served either on the rocks with salt or frozen. May I recommend the top shelf one?  I had the Mariachi Combination platter which included a chilie rellano with cheese, cheese enchilada, guacamole dip, which went perfectly with the tortilla chips, and rice and beans.   This was ok, not the best, but by far not the worst either, just somewhere in between. This is a place you should try if you're in the area and you want to bring out the Fiesta in you!  Plus, every dinner comes with a dessert shot - Kahlua & cream which is a perfect aftertaste for the long walk home. Plus, they give you cinnamon mints with the receipt...yum! For this they receive 3.5 stars! P.S. this is my 100th review...so show me some love yelpsters!

As Mexican food goes, this is pretty standard fare. I feel like it's a dollar or two overpriced on most of their dishes considering the fairly generic dishes they're offering up. However, I do LOVE their margaritas. You can get a very decent sized "half" pitcher of house margaritas for $14. This was at least three or four glasses full for two people....mmm drunk mmm. Also, their complimentary chips and salsa are delish! After dinner and margaritas stick around in the neighborhood - catch a show at The Annoyance or play some shuffle board at Fat Cat.
My wife & LOVE this place! GREAT SERVICE----very reasonably priced food & tasty margheritas. I would give this place 5 stars, only if the margheritas were a tad bit stronger. NEAR PERFECT!!!!

I got the vegetarian fajitas, which doesn't sound like anything extraordinary, but it was fantastic. You get this whole skillet full of grilled onions, peppers, mushrooms, tomatoes and broccoli. More than I could ever eat, but I had my friends there to help me out. Everyone loved it. 2 days later I commented to my friend about having something really good @ Fiesta Mexicana and before I could say what he was like "the vegetarian fajitas?" You gotta try them!

I like this place.  The food is good (maybe not the most delicious but pretty delicious), the service is good and you never feel rushed.  My boyfriend is a giant fan of the pork burrito.  They are open late.  I like that Fiesta Mexicana always has the perfect cross-section of Uptown in the restaurant... a nice mixture of race, gay people, slightly crazy people, girls night out, musicians from the Green Mill, people on dates, families... it's a cozy place for anybody.  They always seem to give you some bonus treat on your plate: maybe a little beef taco or a piece of quesadilla or some other little tid bit.

F-This Place. Waaayyy overpriced.  Everything costs almost double what it should be, comes with NO RICE or BEANS and tastes like crap on a tortilla.  For delivery, I ordered the Combination Plate ($9.95). Taco (punk asses gave me Ground Beef not Steak), Quesadilla (I can make this better at home), and a tamal (I could have got 5 of them outside of Tony's for the same price).  The people I was with said the Chimichanga they ordered ($10) wasn't worth it.  Never eating there again. F-Fiesta Mexicana.

Don't get why there are so many poor reviews. I'm never had bad time here. Admittedly, the food isn't spectacular, but it is good, and not expensive to boot. Margaritas are fan-freakin-tastic. I've always received prompt service, and some of the waiters are downright awesome. Plus, random free kahlua shots. I mean, come on. Great for post-show nommings, especially since, though it's a block from the Riviera, no one who goes there seems to know about it.

First visit there I had a pretty good lunch though nothing that made me need to go right back. So i held off for two months...and the 2nd visit wasn't great. I forget what I go so that tells you how memorable of a lunch it was. A little high in price for lunch... and if I would eat there again I'll wait till its warm again. the inside is awful and smells... funky. Yeah funk smell, too expensive, the only good thing was the service was great, but maybe the knew i didn't like the funk smell and were trying to get me out of there quickly.

I'm going to preface this review by saying that I just spent two years in Los Angeles and probably had some of the best, real Mexican food of my life while living there, so I might be a little biased.  If I could, I would have given 2 1/2 stars to this place because I think 2 is a little too harsh but 3 too much. My wife and I went here for lunch and had what I would call an average to slightly below meal. The free chips and salsa is a good start. I had a lunch combo consisting of the Quesadilla, Tamale, and Taco. It was fairly good and filled me up to say the least. If you ladies are looking for a nice, light salad here, do not order the Taco Salad. My wife ordered it, and it had enough greasy ground beef on it to choke a donkey, and basically a minimum of other ingredients that would constitute a salad. They also have some funky rule with refills on their sodas? I decided to not start drinking Margaritas at one in the afternoon on this particular day, but they did look good. I think I'll be giving this little neighborhood place another shot and will go for some dinner next time.

In this booming block of Uptown, I was surprised to find that two of my lunch picks don't open 'til 4 pm. Hmm. I spotted Fiesta Mexicana and decided that yeah, I can deal with a burrito! Lunch specials galore for around $6 and some change. However... $1.50 for a SIDE of sour cream? And even more appalling.... $3.50 for a small side of guacamole. $5 in mere sides does not a lunch special make.  My burrito was smothered in a Ranchero sauce. Not terrible, but I'm a 'hands-on' kind of girl. Meaning, I like burritos I can pick up with my hands, not break out the fork and knife. Rice was left untouched and the accompanying beans were standard refried. My Diet Coke was also a part of the lunch special, though I'm still waiting on that refill.... As Yelp suggests, I'm gonna go with 'A-OK' on this one. Bonus: free chips and zesty salsa (ahem, which warranted aforementioned refill).

Great margaritas AWFUL service.   The place is very small placev(much smaller than the Lincoln Park location) with plenty of waiters and yet it took over a half hour to get the waitress to come back to our table after our drinks were served.  We were there for over an hour for TWO margaritas.  It was not crowded either. I did get an apology and a free shot, but we missed the beginning of My Bloody Valentine so that did not really make up for it. I will not be returning to this location.

Fiesta fiesta!  Cheap but satisfying Mexican fare. I've found the service to be friendly and fast. My favorite thing (that for some reason I can't find now in NYC) is the HORCHATA! (Homemade rice drink with cinnamon and nuts...I think almonds) There is also a fine selection of margaritas, etc., if you are more inclined to have an adult beverage with your quesadillas or what have you.

We love to eat here.  Its close to home.  The food is delicious.   The salsa is good and hot. They are open late.  The atmosphere cracks us up!  Year round Christmas lights and cheesy Latin music videos on the TV in the corner.  Once you are able to order the food, it arrives at the table very fast.   The staff is friendly and will assist you.  I would caution new visitors with this: all of the servers definitely need to be more attentive.  They do not visit the table often enough.  This can be very frustrating especially if you are in a hurry.  My recommendation is that, when dining here, do not be shy. Ask any employee who comes anywhere near table to assit you.  For most restaurants I would take off many stars in the rating for this but I really am a fan of this place. In the summer, they offer outdoor seating but I am not a fan of the outdoor ambiance at this particular intersection and I would miss fiesta atmosphere inside that I mentioned above.  I also fear that sitting outdoors would make it much harder to attract the server's attention. We will definitely return.  We eat here often.

I make it into Fiesta Mexicana maybe every other month or so and it's pretty good. I've never had anything bad on the menu, and they have amazing margarita specials sometimes, where they bring you absurdly large pitchers of the stuff for only $9 or $10 (I forget exactly, but it was a good deal). The service is excellent, and there's never a wait. There is no particular item I would write home about, if anything the place is a sure bet when you need a mexican food fix that's convenient and quick.

Never a bad meal here. Delicious nachos, good salsa, nice drink selection, bla de blah. Tasty chiles rellenos, too--for some reason, too many restaurants screw those things up, but this place gets it right.

My go-to spot for pre-show margaritas. Also used to venture over here as an under-ager in hopes of getting served (50/50 chance). I'm not a regular and I have not tried everything on the menu but I've never had problems with any of the food - its always been good. Plus they've always been very accomodating and I appreciate that.

There are two things that I really like here - the chips and salsa, and the carnitas taco. Not those other ones - the carnitas!! We've tried a number of other dishes here and they were all just okay - generally bland but not bad. But the carnitas taco rocks - it's got these little chunks of pork that are juicy and tender, while still being a bit crispy on the outside. They put that on top of two warm corn tortillas with pico de gallo and guacamole. For about $3 it's the perfect small lunch or afternoon snack. I say go for the carnitas taco and leave the rest!

I was turned on to this place by my wife , she loves good food especially fish. We go there for the Snapper in tomatoe sauce. Have been there at least 15 times. EVERY time the snapper is on the money. Great service. Good salsa. Friendly staff. Open late,

This is the Fiesta Mexicana to go to for the Guanchinango Veracruzana (deep fried snapper in a tomato based sauce).  Did you ever see those old Tom & Jerry cartoons where they put a fish in their mouth & in one fail swoop all that's left is bones?  That's what this dish looks like after I'm done with it.  Have it with the corn tortillas & a ptcher of margaritas from a rooster pitcher.  FOR SURE my favorite fish dish anywhere in Chicago.

I love this place, after switching to vegetarian diet, i only miss a few dishes and the mixed fajitas at Fiesta top the list.  They are the best in the city.  That being said, I still gorge on the vegi fajitas, the great rice and beans, and the fresh tasty guac. The chips and salsa are superb.  Fiesta does what so many eateries are afraid of, adding heat to "spicy" food.  The salsa is hot just like any respectable salsa should be and we love it.  An authentic Mexican meal with homemade tortilla chips, hot salsa, fresh guacamole, margaritas, and some late night Jazz next door (Green Mill) = perfect night.

Not the best Mexican I've had, not the worst. It fit the bill, as it was the first place we ran across after finding a parking spot. Famished, we settled for the...ahem...beautiful interior at Fiesta Mexicana! It's pretty kitschy Tex/Mex ambience. Lots of fake flowers, some very large murals...clean enough, etc.  The food was a bit pricey, and greasy. I mean $11 for a burrito seems steep to me with all the other joints in the 'hood. It was covered with some sort of drenching suace which made it impossible to pick up and eat...ya know, if I don't have to use utensils, I'm happy, but oh well ;)  Rice was super dry and wow, if I had a problem with my food groups all touching each other...this plate would've sent me into shock. Probably good for some late night grub, or large pitchers of margaritas for the local crowd. Waiter was polite and helpful and our food was lightening fast...

Maybe I haven't been to enough, but this is one of the better Mexican restaurants I've gone to in Chicago. Some friends and I went a few times after rehearsal at the Uptown Writers Space above the Green Mill. Decent good food and pretty quick.  Margarita pitchers are HUGE. It's almost a chore trying to finish these off between three people. Definitely take public transportation if you plan on ordering a pitcher.

First of all, I'm huge!  Not just in size but mentality.  I like to eat.  And what I like to eat most...Mexican Food! My colombian partner and I have sought out some of the finest mexican food from Phoenix, Arizona to Nashville, TN.  And let me say that Chicago wouldn't know what to do with REALLY good Mexican food.   We have attempted Fiesta Mexicana TWICE now because we were desperate.  However, the food is bland, the chips are as thick as cardboard, and the food ALL tastes the same.  The guacamole is FULL of avocado...but NO TASTE?  Maybe I'm spoiled, no, OBVIOUSLY I'm spoiled because I have yet to find a good Mexican place in Chicago.  People should talk more here, lose the passive-aggressive demeanor and maybe there would be more community, better food, and places to go besides just the pretentious bars!  I thought this place must be a front, but it sounds (from other reviews) like its just the only place to go in uptown when you're too drunk to care. Too bad.

We went here for the first time last night, and I loved it!  Had steak fajitas which were incredible - tender steak, yummy vegetables, fresh tortillas.  Served in a giant skillet - nice! Really, I was more satisfied with this Mexican restaurant than I've been in a long time.  I thought it would be kind of a generic place based on the exterior and the name, but it was amazing.  I'll definitely be back!

Reliable and tasty. A pitcher of margaritas between two will knock your socks off...On Tuesdays (I think...but maybe not) the pitchers are 15 dollars. I don't consider myself an expert on true Mexican cuisine but I find their chille relleno quite tasty. Their salsa's got a bit of kick to it. Whenever I've been in the tables are full.

I am not a fan of fiesta mexicana. The seating is very uncomfortable and is awkward. Furthermore, the food leaves a lot to be desired. There is a weird aftertaste to the chips. I feel like I can make a good mexican fiesta in my home. Its also quite pricey, and the portions are not huge. For mexican, I recommend looking elsewhere for Mexican food and frequenting thai or vietnamese when in uptown.

Ugh. HORRIBLE. I should have been tipped off by the American cheese blanketing the steak enchiladas. Went here latenight, and got a carry out. Came home, ate it. PAID the next day with flulike symptoms and more! I will never eat here again. Disgusting. Who are the people that like the swill they serve here? They must have no tastebuds. Total gringo fare.

This place has a huge menu of pretty authentic Mexican food.  I've always had really quick service here--last time we were running late for a show at the Green Mill and we weren't sure if we'd have time to grab a bite on the way.  Then I remembered Fiesta...We plopped down at the bar, and almost immediately in front of us were chips & salsa, two plates of food and a half pitcher of margaritas.  We were in and out of there in under 30 minutes.  Plus, the bartender even gave us free shots of...something.  Not sure what it was, but it was tasty.  This place can get pretty crowded sometimes and it's pretty tiny, so it's probably not the best for groups.  I'd suggest the one on Lincoln if you have a crowd to feed.

normally i'd agree with the other reviews. the service is a little slow & the food a little pricey but pretty tasty. used to stop in when in the neighborhood. yep-used to. the last time i went there, the place was nearly empty so i'd figured i'd be in & out. told the busboy i was in a bit of a hurry & can i just give him my order. he said he'll get the waiter. no biggie, i just started thumbing through the reader i grabbed at the bookstore a couple doors north. after about ten min.'s, i looked up to see a waiter & a waitress (the one with the attitude-don't get me statred on her) sitting & eating at the counter. here comes the busboy again. i politely asked him to just please put in the order for me or get someone. he gave me a pissy traffic cop stop sign with his hand. so i was in & out faster than i thought, just hungrier. next time i have AMPLE  time & in the mood for the occasional attitude i might go back.

My favorite Mexican cuisine in the city!! They have awesome Flauta's and the salsa is really, really good. Service is quick, the jukebox is fun, and they have my favorite hamburgers as well (I like thin hamburgers, not hefty). During the breaks between sets at the Green Mill, I highly recommend cruising next door to grab a bite of some good, nothing fancy Mexican food.

Quality Mexican food served in an authentic setting.  They have the usual array of choices that other Mexican restaurants have.  They are right next door to the Green Mill and across from the Aragon Ballroom.
